page.title: 02Crewes House, Farleigh
page.content: A stoney, bumpy lane bordered by fields in which horses graze.Rounding the bend you see Crewe's House, dating from the Domesday Survey. Mary Flint, the lady of the house, related its history. Fifty years ago it was a children's home.It was requisitioned during World War II as a home for Canadian soldiers. The present house dates from 1800, containing 16th century rafters,beams and the original fireplace and baker's oven. The house has been divided into three separate houses,two large houses, a bungalow which was the servants' quarters. In the early morning,Mary feeds her thirteen cats,three dogs, three horses. Housework takes the remainder of the morning.Next she cooks lunch and dinner.The afternoon involves exercising the dogs and horses.By evening everyone is tired, looking forward to relaxing and T.V.
